author: Couch Co-op

text: This song perfectly captures the feel of 16 bit JRPGs. I love modern games, and some truly great masterpieces are created every generation including this current one, but I still consider the 16 bit days the greatest era of gaming so far.
author: Lloyd Martin

text: +Lloyd Martin It's true, really. As great as all the other generations are, nothing can really compete with the 16-bit era. The sheer amount of instant classics that were created within those short 6 years was simply astounding. You just don't see that kind of quality in games nowadays.

text: @DoomsdayOdd Just looked them up. They were called Territorial Oaks and they always exploded at the end of the battle after defeating them. You might've gotten lucky and missed them if you went through Peaceful Rest Valley really fast. One of easiest places to die in the game IMO since you only have Ness.

text:
The official track listing calls this "Boy Meets Girl (Twoson)." How cute.

I have a list of all the songs you've posted since I'm so OCD, and the only game that's had more entries on your list is Chrono Trigger. But you still haven't gotten to Smiles and Tears, dammit! It's going to be at X00, I hope.
author: David E.

text: @AmericanVideoGames In my opinion, Mother 3 is so much superior to Earthbound in every way. From that certain event in the beginning of the game to the end of the story, I've discovered happiness, loneliness, anger, hatred and sadness; all in one tight cartridge.

text: After so many entries, I don't really have much more to say about the amazing Earthbound. I really liked all the towns in this game, they all had their own feel and atmosphere.
